metadata.title: CVE-2022-29909 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Documents in deeply-nested cross-origin browsing contexts could haveobtained permissions granted to the top-level origin, bypassing theexisting prompt and wrongfully inheriting the top-level permissions. Thisvulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.9, Firefox ESR < 91.9, and Firefox <100.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29909` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs91: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
